isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD MODEL 292, 392, 492 - ADJUSTMENTS - SWIVEL MITER AND T-BOX MITER

svcproc.title: SWIVEL MITER AND T-BOX MITER
svcproc.para: The relief valve plunger used with the swivel and T-box miters uses an adjustable relief valve plunger. Access to this adjustment is gained by removing the two housing retaining clamps and lifting the housing off the steering gear bearing cap. To make the adjustment, the retaining clamp bars are re-installed and the bolts are tightened to specifications. Start the engine and turn the actuating shaft using a socket and ratchet on the actuating shaft nut. Use a screwdriver to turn the plunger in or out of the bearing cap until the proper clearance is obtained at the steering knuckle axle stop ( Figure 137).

figure.caption: Figure 137. Obtain Proper Clearance at Steering Knuckle Axle Stop

svcproc.para: When the adjustment has been completed, stop the engine and re-install the miter housing at its original location ( Figure 138).

figure.caption: Figure 138. Re-install Miter Housing at Original Location

note.para: The miter housing in most cases will be indexed to the bearing cap with a roll pin which passes through the clamping bar and enters a drilled hole in the miter housing. This ensures that the miter housing is placed in its optimum position. The locating pin will also keep the housing from turning in service. During reassembly, make sure that the locating pin is properly installed ( Figure 139).

figure.caption: Figure 139. Make Sure Locating Pin Properly Installed

caution.para: Re-tighten the actuating shaft nut to proper specifications as it may have loosened during the adjustment procedures. Tighten the nut to 50 ft-lbs. (68 Nm) ( Figure 140).
